snippet: Some plans with inadequate coverage policies will be canceled, but consumers will not be left out in the cold.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Congressional Republicans for stoking consumer fears and confusion with charges that the health care reform law is causing insurers to cancel existing policies and will force many people to pay higher premiums; asserts that overblown controversy obscures the crux of the health care reform law, which is that it guarantees that everyone can buy decent insurance without being turned away or charged exorbitant rates.
lead_paragraph: Some plans with inadequate coverage policies will be canceled, but consumers will not be left out in the cold.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
